result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry A Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Straight time to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 127 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys, Atty Wolff for Atty Williamson.  Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on March 24, 2016

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the fact attorney Wolff is new to this case.  Defendant wishes to proceed forward to sentencing today.  Court steps down so Attorney Bayer can check into his notes on this case.  Case recalled at 9:51 am.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
12 months jail.  (Credit - 127 days).  Commences immediately.  Concurrent to any other sentence. 
COSTS:  $368.00 Bail to be applied from case # 15CF1176. 
DNA previously done. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williamson moves for an adjournment until after sentencing in Milwaukee County.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Terry A Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Attorney Williamson requests a modification of bail or bail conditions to include Huber bailee.   State objects to a modification of bail.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
